bug.short_desc: broken F24-F25/rawhide upgrade path due to mozilla-https-everywhere-5.1.9 (or newer) missing in F25+
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: There are no builds of 5.1.9 (or newer) for F25+, hence the package gets downgraded to 5.1.4 upon F24->F25/rawhide upgrade.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): 5.1.4-1.fc25
How reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. dnf system-upgrade --releasever=25 download
Actual results: Downgrading: mozilla-https-everywhere noarch 5.1.4-1.fc25 fedora 1.6 M
Expected results: Upgrading: mozilla-https-everywhere noarch 5.1.9-1.fc25 fedora 1.6 M
mozilla-https-everywhere-5.2.7-2.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-80c2ca4d1f
mozilla-https-everywhere-5.2.7-2.fc23 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 23. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-1f3ae23d36
mozilla-https-everywhere-5.2.7-2.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-f8d3e141ca

mozilla-https-everywhere-5.2.7-2.fc23 has been pushed to the Fedora 23 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-1f3ae23d36
